summary.text_en: Darwin proposed: organisms evolve through natural selection. Those adapted to environment survive, passing favorable traits to offspring. This explains Earth's biodiversity.
key_points_en: Natural selection: survival of the fittest

story.text_en: Darwin sailed the world for 5 years on HMS Beagle. In GalÃ¡pagos, he observed different beak shapes on different islandsâ€”making him wonder: do organisms change? After 20 years of thought, he published Origin of Species.

fun_facts.text_en: Darwin almost became a clergyman! He studied theology at Cambridge, but love of nature led him to science.
He was seasick for 5 years during the voyage, but persisted in observing and recording.
He pondered 20 years before daring to publish, fearing Church attacks.

experiment.description_en: Observe different bird beak shapes and their food in parks. Long beaks eat insects, short beaks eat seeds. This is natural selection: beak shape adapted to food type!
experiment.why_en: Different environments need different traits, natural selection retains best adapted.

simple_explanation.text_en: Organisms slowly change. Those adapted to environment survive, passing traits to offspring. Like giraffes' necks getting longer because they could reach high leaves!

impact.text_en: Evolution completely changed humanity's understanding of life's origins, becoming modern biology's cornerstone. From medicine to agriculture, from ecology to genetic engineering, all build on evolution.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Classification system provided framework for evolution research

influenced.contribution_en: Gene editing based on evolutionary principles

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Darwin's evolution built on Linnaeus's classification. Later, Mendel's genetics explained how variation arises, DNA discovery provided molecular evidence. From observing finches to editing genesâ€”a clear knowledge legacy path.
